H0.text: An organ is the most basic level of organization in the human body that Miranda learned about while studying how the human body carries out life functions.

H1.text: A system is the most basic level of organization in the human body for carrying out life functions, as Miranda learned.

H2.text: A tissue is the most basic level of organization in the human body, which Miranda learned about when studying how the human body carries out life functions.

H3.text: A cell is the most basic level of organization in the human body, as Miranda learned that it is the foundation for how the human body carries out life functions.

A4.text: The cell is the basic structural and functional unit of all forms of life or organisms.
